results.title: [Should type 2 diabetes prevention pharmacological studies prompt us to change our prescription habits?].
results.text_hl: A relative risk reduction of conversion from @<m>DISEASE_Usher_Syndrome_Type_IG</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C564643 @@@IG@@@ to @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@T2D@@@ has been obtained with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ in the @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@Diabetes@@@ Prevention Program, but this effect seems to be directly linked to the antihyperglycaemic effect of the drug.

citations.NLM: Blicklé JF. [Should type 2 diabetes prevention pharmacological studies prompt us to change our prescription habits?]. Diabetes Metab. 2003 Nov;29(5):547-53. PMID: 14631333
